context: The Finnish word 'vahva' is an adjective that means strong, powerful or robust. It can refer to physical strength, like a strong swimmer ('Hän on vahva uimari'), the strength of an argument ('Tämä on vahva argumentti'), or even the force of nature like wind ('Vahva tuuli kaatoi puun'). The word declines based on case and number; 'vahvat' is the plural nominative form. It has comparative forms such as 'vahvempi' (stronger) and superlative 'vahvin' (strongest).
